Headline: Building brands from the ground up!
Comment:
Rishabh Mariwala It's time to fundamentally reimagine the supply chain.

At Floryo , we're not just tweaking the traditional model‚Äîwe're turning it on its head. Leveraging technology, we've built a demand-driven system where finished goods inventory is virtually zero. In fact, we might be the only company in the FMCG space operating at scale with zero FG inventory.

We don't manufacture and then sell‚Äîwe sell, and then manufacture.üòä

This inversion of the conventional approach offers a ‚Äúfresh‚Äù take on Just-In-Time (JIT). While early-stage operational efficiency can take a hit, scale quickly neutralizes that. More importantly, the elimination of dead inventory and locked working capital creates a significant strategic advantage.

The future of supply chain isn't incremental‚Äîit's transformative. Its high time we should be ready to let go of legacy models & embrace a truly responsive, tech-enabled ecosystem?

Headline: Founder Brand Monkies | Branding & E-commerce | Helping D2C Brands scale & grow | Building profitable brands | B2B & D2C
Comment:
Rishabh Mariwala hope you find value with this comment.

Failing to have inventory at the right time & adding inventory at the wrong time, is a pain to the system financially. 

Here‚Äôs a real case:
There‚Äôs a much similar case last October 2024. One of our client failed to stock a product (just a particular colour) which affected almost 30% of sales, And they refilled it by end of November. 

Now it‚Äôs a winter wear. The stock added was almost at end of sale season. Usually winter sales for sweatshirts & hoodies continues to have its peak till December mid & slows down by Jan first half. 

What happened it the inventory got dumped still. Almost 5 months, 3.5 Cr worth finished products & 2 crore worth raw materials.
